body: cc @gtm-nayan , probably related to #9808 - though we still need a reproduction if that snippet isn't enough to reproduce
Sure, I'll try to reproduce that with a very basic repro

@dummdidumm it might be related to Sanity at this stage? Not very sure, but I tried to reproduce it as minimal as possible using my use case: rendering a Sanity Studio on a route using `onMount`

https://github.com/flayks/sk-bug-1.15.11

As it, the build breaks with a similar error. If you comment the [line #3](https://github.com/flayks/sk-bug-1.15.11/blob/39c8dbd4c408c29d94ec446386ce81679365b0b5/apps/website/src/routes/%2Bpage.svelte#L3), it builds normally ðŸ¤·

`import { defineConfig, renderStudio } from 'sanity'`

What bugs me out is that it builds fine on 1.15.10, but not on 1.15.11. Should the imports for `defineConfig` and `renderStudio` be in the `onMount` as well?

it was probably #9811 instead, although it seems I forgot to push the changeset for that one.

Some of my assumptions around how the vite manifest works didn't hold true, I thought the nodes would be present as is in the manifest but they get renamed if the bundler decides to put in more stuff into them.

Does anyone know if there is a way in vite/rollup to track which chunk a module ends up in?

issue.title: fix: file not found in manifest during build
issue.body:
fixes #9843 

This ensures there is a key for these files in the manifest. Surely there has got to be a better way than this but just leaving it here in case the problems are more widespread and needs a fix overnight. Slightly less efficient than not having these entry points but still beats what we had before.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [ ] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [ ] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.

body:
Similar error on build here with https://github.com/brandtam/sveltekit-sanity-starter 

If you clone and build now it works. But if you change 
```
"@sveltejs/kit": "1.15.10",
```

to 
```
"@sveltejs/kit": "^1.15.10",
```

in package.json to allow a for a newer version of Kit and then build it will break with the `Error: Could not find file ".svelte-kit/generated/client-optimized/nodes/5.js" in Vite manifest` error.

issue.title: Can't build quickstart project

repository.name: sveltepress
repository.description: A content centered site build tool, build on top of Sveltekit.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Npm run build fails in quickstart project.


### Reproduction

run "npm create @sveltepress"
run npm install
run npm run build
Error message after running npm run build: Could not find file ".svelte-kit/generated/client-optimized/nodes/0.js" in Vite manifest

### Logs

```shell
Could not find file ".svelte-kit/generated/client-optimized/nodes/0.js" in Vite manifest
```


### Screenshots

_No response_

### Severity

blocking all usage of sveltepress

body: I don't use sanity, but got the same error.
